"They march splendidly," remarked some- one in Bagrati6n's suite. 
The head of the column had already de- scended into the hollow. The clash would take place on this side of it 
The remains of our regiment which had been in action rapidly formed up and moved to the right; from behind it, dispersing the laggards, came two battalions of the Sixth Chasseurs in fine order. Before they had reached Bagration, the weighty tread of the
